bibl.title: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, May 10, 1944

div1.p: Truby writes that the photographs of the yellow fever huts are authentic. He also states that the model of Camp Columbia by Yldefonso Perez is accurate and very well done.

div1.head: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, May 10, 1944
div1.opener:
Albert E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco, California
May 10/44
Dear Col. Hench:
div1.p:
I have your letter of Apr 22 and
a copy of your interview with
Gan. Kean. Am inclosing my comments
on such questions as I feel that
I have pertinent information.

The photo of the Y.F. huts is certainly
authentic. You will be surprised
when you compare it with
the photo of the Idelfonso model.

The buildings in that model were
very well done and very exact
as to scale & appearance.

AC
T
The Carlisle photos were supposed
to be on ground with contures as shown
on the map. But in the photo. it looks
flat just as in the photos of Camp Lazear.

I have not heard anything from
Hoebers (publishers) re my book
for a long time so don't know
how the sales are going. The
person who handled my correspondence
there has left the Co. and so I have
not had any information. Have
my first check for the sale ofduring
the 1st six months. $ 460. much
more than I ever expected.

Don't forget to send me photostat
copies (Extracts) of Reed's letters that mention
me.

I am still doing nicely and
really am most comfortable.
Remember me to my old friend Goldthwait.
